20220119214622058407.card_body: ### What's this?\nI'm drawing inspiration from a **[PyCon 2012](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o9pEzgHorH0&ab_channel=NextDayVideo)** presentation called Stop Writing Classes which basically is about simplifying code, or maybe more like don't overcomplicate code.

20220119220503556374.card_body: The presenter says this is a challenge they give to prospective hires. How would I solve it?

20220119220617041422.card_body:
The rules are thus:

1. Any live cell with two or three live neighbours survives.

2. Any dead cell with three live neighbours becomes a live cell.

3. All other live cells die in the next generation. Similarly, all other dead cells stay dead.

How would I implement this?
